titleStmt.title: W. A. Randall to Ephraim L. Van Winkle
CWG4505

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Washington D. C
Dec 28. 1863.
E L Vanwinkle
Frankfort
Ky
My Dear Sir,
I enclose you the Petition of William Forbes of Jackson County for the remittance of a fine
It should have been presented before now, but, better late than never. Do me the favor to have the Governor remit and Send the same to "William Forbes McKee Ky" or to the Clerk.
I shall spend the holliday in making myself acquainted with & transacting business before the departments and in getting posted as to the running of this Machine
Tell the Journal man to keep his shirt on.

I am very respectfully &
truly yr friend &c
W. A. Randall
